member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Alert(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Wraps all alerts with close functionality. To have your alerts animate out when closed, make sure they have the .fade and .in class already applied to them. An data-dismiss="alert" attribute is still required.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Alert(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,System.String)
member.summary: Performs an operation on an alert. Actually, only "close" is supported.
member.param: An operation string. Actually, only "close" is supported.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Alert(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,Bridge.Bootstrap3.AlertOperation)
member.summary: Performs an operation on an alert. Actually, only "close" is supported.
member.param: An operation. Actually, only "close" is supported.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.AlertClose(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Closes an alert.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Button(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Enable buttons. Data attributes are still required.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Button(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,System.String)
member.summary: The effect of this method depends on the "str" parameter. The "str" parameter could be an operation string: "toggle", "loading", "reset"; or an arbitrary string - in that case it resets button state - swaps text to any data defined text state.
member.param: It could be an operation string: "toggle", "loading", "reset"; or an arbitrary string - in that case it resets button state - swaps text to any data defined text state.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Button(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,Bridge.Bootstrap3.ButtonOperation)
member.summary: Does something with a button - "loading", "reset" or "toggle" operations.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.ButtonLoading(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Sets button state to loading - disables button and swaps text to loading text. Loading text should be defined on the button element using the data attribute data-loading-text.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.ButtonReset(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Resets button state - swaps text to original text.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.ButtonToggle(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Toggles push state. Gives the button the appearance that it has been activated.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Modal(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOptions)
member.summary: Either toggles, shows or hides a modal. Depends on the "operation" parameter which might be "toggle", "show" or "hide". Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown or hidden (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal or hidden.bs.modal event occurs).
member.param: The jQuery object with a modal or modals

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Modal(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,System.String)
member.summary: Either toggles, shows or hides a modal. Depends on the "operation" parameter which might be "toggle", "show" or "hide". Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown or hidden (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal or hidden.bs.modal event occurs).
member.param: The jQuery object with a modal or modals
The operation to be done. Either "toggle", "show" or "hide.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.Modal(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery,Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOperation)
member.summary: Either toggles, shows or hides a modal. Depends on the "operation" parameter which might be "toggle", "show" or "hide". Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown or hidden (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal or hidden.bs.modal event occurs).
member.param: The jQuery object with a modal or modals
The operation to be done. Either "toggle", "show" or "hide.

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.ModalHide(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Hides a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been hidden (i.e. before the hidden.bs.modal event occurs).
member.param: The jQuery object with a modal or modals

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.ModalShow(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Opens a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal event occurs).
member.param: The jQuery object with a modal or modals

member.name: M:Bridge.Bootstrap3.Bootstrap.ModalToggle(Bridge.jQuery2.jQuery)
member.summary: Toggles a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown or hidden (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal or hidden.bs.modal event occurs).
member.param: The jQuery object with a modal or modals

The operation to be done. The only one is actually supported - "show".

member.summary: Activates a tab element and content container. Tab should have either a data-target or an href targeting a container node in the DOM.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixOffset
member.summary: Affix offset

member.summary: Bottom offset

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixOffset.Top
member.summary: Top offset

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixOptions
member.summary: Affix options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixOptions.Offset
member.summary: Pixels to offset from screen when calculating position of scroll. If a single number is provided, the offset will be applied in both top and bottom directions. To provide a unique, bottom and top offset just provide an object offset: { top: 10 } or offset: { top: 10, bottom: 5 }. Use a function when you need to dynamically calculate an offset. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixOptions.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element of the affix. Either a selector string, a DOM element or a jQuery object. Defaults to the window object.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent
member.summary: Affix events

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent.Affix
member.summary: This event fires immediately before the element has been affixed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent.Affixed
member.summary: This event is fired after the element has been affixed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent.AffixTop
member.summary: This event fires immediately before the element has been affixed-top.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent.AffixedTop
member.summary: This event is fired after the element has been affixed-top.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent.AffixBottom
member.summary: This event fires immediately before the element has been affixed-bottom.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.AffixEvent.AffixedBottom
member.summary: This event is fired after the element has been affixed-bottom.

member.summary: Alert events

member.summary: Possible operations on a button

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ButtonOperation.Loading
member.summary: Sets button state to loading - disables button and swaps text to loading text. Loading text should be defined on the button element using the data attribute data-loading-text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ButtonOperation.Reset
member.summary: Resets button state - swaps text to original text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ButtonOperation.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles push state. Gives the button the appearance that it has been activated.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOptions
member.summary: Carousel options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOptions.Interval
member.summary: The amount of time to delay between automatically cycling an item. If false, carousel will not automatically cycle. Defaults to 5000.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOptions.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the cycling of the carousel on mouseenter and resumes the cycling of the carousel on mouseleave. Defaults to "hover".

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOptions.Wrap
member.summary: Whether the carousel should cycle continuously or have hard stops. Defaults to true.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOperation
member.summary: Carousel operations

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOperation.Cycle
member.summary: Cycles through the carousel items from left to right.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOperation.Next
member.summary: Cycles to the next item.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOperation.Pause
member.summary: Stops the carousel from cycling through items.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselOperation.Prev
member.summary: Cycles to the previous item.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselEvent
member.summary: Carousel events. Both events have the following additional properties: - direction: The direction in which the carousel is sliding (either "left" or "right"). - relatedTarget: The DOM element that is being slid into place as the active item.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselEvent.Slid
member.summary: This event is fired when the carousel has completed its slide transition.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CarouselEvent.Slide
member.summary: This event fires immediately when the slide instance method is invoked.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOptions
member.summary: Collapse options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOptions.Parent
member.summary: If selector then all collapsible elements under the specified parent will be closed when this collapsible item is shown. (similar to traditional accordion behavior - this dependent on the panel class) Defaults to no parent.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOptions.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles the collapsible element on invocation Defaults to true.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOperation
member.summary: Collapse operations

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOperation.Hide
member.summary: Hides a collapsible element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOperation.Show
member.summary: Shows a collapsible element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseOperation.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles a collapsible element to shown or hidden.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseEvent
member.summary: Collapse events

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseEvent.Hide
member.summary: This event is fired immediately when the hide method has been called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseEvent.Hidden
member.summary: This event is fired when a collapse element has been hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseEvent.Show
member.summary: This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.CollapseEvent.Shown
member.summary: This event is fired when a collapse element has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverEvent
member.summary: Popover events

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverEvent.Hide
member.summary: This event is fired immediately when the hide instance method has been called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverEvent.Hidden
member.summary: This event is fired when the popover has finished being hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverEvent.Show
member.summary: This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverEvent.Shown
member.summary: This event is fired when the popover has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOperation.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles an element's tooltip/popover.

member.summary: Tooltip/popover delay

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupDelay.Hide
member.summary: A delay for hiding of a tooltip/popover

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupDelay.Show
member.summary: A delay for showing of a tooltip/popover

member.summary: Tooltip/popover placement

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupTrigger
member.summary: Tooltip/popover trigger

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupViewport
member.summary: Tooltip/popover viewport

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupViewport.Selector
member.summary: Selector

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupViewport.Padding
member.summary: Padding

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions
member.summary: A base class for a tooltip and a popover options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Animation
member.summary: Apply a CSS fade transition to the tooltip/popover. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Container
member.summary: Appends the tooltip/popover to a specific element. Example: container: 'body'. This option is particularly useful in that it allows you to position the tooltip/popover in the flow of the document near the triggering element - which will prevent the tooltip/popover from floating away from the triggering element during a window resize. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Delay
member.summary: Delay showing and hiding the tooltip/popover (ms) - does not apply to manual trigger type. If a number is supplied, delay is applied to both hide/show Object structure is: delay: { show: 500, hide: 100 } Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Html
member.summary: Insert HTML into the tooltip/popover. If false, jQuery's text method will be used to insert content into the DOM. Use text if you're worried about XSS attacks. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Placement
member.summary: How to position the tooltip/popover - top | bottom | left | right | auto. When "auto" is specified, it will dynamically reorient the tooltip/popover. For example, if placement is "auto left", the tooltip/popover will display to the left when possible, otherwise it will display right. You can define a function which returns a placement string. The two arguments are passed to a function - a tooltip/popover and a target DOM elements. Defaults to 'top'.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Selector
member.summary: If a selector is provided, tooltip/popover objects will be delegated to the specified targets. In practice, this is used to enable dynamic HTML content to have tooltips/popovers added. See this Issue: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/4215 and an informative example: http://jsfiddle.net/fScua/ Defaults to no selector.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Title
member.summary: Default title value if title attribute isn't present. If a function is given, you can access the element that the popover is attached to via the "this" reference (Script.This<Element>()). Defaults to "".

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Trigger
member.summary: How tooltip/popover is triggered - click | hover | focus | manual. You may pass multiple triggers; separate them with a space. Defaults to "hover focus" for a tooltip and "click" for a popover.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopupOptions.Viewport
member.summary: Keeps the tooltip within the bounds of this element. Example: viewport: '#viewport' or { selector: '#viewport', padding: 0 } Defaults to { selector: 'body', padding: 0 }.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TooltipOptions.Template
member.summary: Base HTML to use when creating the tooltip. The tooltip's title will be injected into the .tooltip-inner. .tooltip-arrow will become the tooltip's arrow. The outermost wrapper element should have the .tooltip class. Defaults to

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverOptions
member.summary: Popover options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverOptions.Content
member.summary: Default content value if data-content attribute isn't present. If a function is given, you can access the element that the popover is attached to via the "this" reference (Script.This<Element>()). Defaults to ''.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.PopoverOptions.Template
member.summary: Base HTML to use when creating the popover. The popover's title will be injected into the .popover-title. The popover's content will be injected into the .popover-content. .arrow will become the popover's arrow. The outermost wrapper element should have the .popover class. Defaults to

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyOptions
member.summary: ScrollSpy options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyOptions.Target
member.summary: The string selector of the target.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyOptions.Offset
member.summary: Pixels to offset from top when calculating position of scroll. Defaults to 10.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyOperation
member.summary: Possible operations on a scrollspy

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyOperation.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the ScrollSpy element. It should be done if adding or removing of elements from the DOM.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyEvent
member.summary: ScrollSpy events

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ScrollSpyEvent.Activate
member.summary: This event fires whenever a new item becomes activated by the scrollspy.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownOperation
member.summary: Possible operations on a dropdown

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownOperation.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles the dropdown menu of a given navbar or tabbed navigation.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownEvent
member.summary: Events of a dropdown

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownEvent.Show
member.summary: This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called. The toggling anchor element is available as the relatedTarget property of the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownEvent.Shown
member.summary: This event is fired when the dropdown has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions, to complete). The toggling anchor element is available as the relatedTarget property of the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownEvent.Hide
member.summary: This event is fired immediately when the hide instance method has been called. The toggling anchor element is available as the relatedTarget property of the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.DropdownEvent.Hidden
member.summary: This event is fired when the dropdown has finished being hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions, to complete). The toggling anchor element is available as the relatedTarget property of the event.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOperation
member.summary: Possible operations on a modal

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOperation.Hide
member.summary: Hides a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been hidden (i.e. before the hidden.bs.modal event occurs).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOperation.Show
member.summary: Opens a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal event occurs).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOperation.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles a modal. Returns to the caller before the modal has actually been shown or hidden (i.e. before the shown.bs.modal or hidden.bs.modal event occurs).

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOptions
member.summary: Modal options

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOptions.Backdrop
member.summary: Includes a modal-backdrop element. Alternatively, specify static for a backdrop which doesn't close the modal on click. It might be the boolean or the string 'static' Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOptions.Keyboard
member.summary: Closes the modal when escape key is pressed. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOptions.Show
member.summary: Shows the modal when initialized. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalOptions.Path
member.summary: If a remote URL is provided, content will be loaded one time via jQuery's load method and injected into the .modal-content div. Defaults to false.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalEvent
member.summary: Events of a modal

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalEvent.Hide
member.summary: This event is fired immediately when the hide instance method has been called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalEvent.Hidden
member.summary: This event is fired when the modal has finished being hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalEvent.Loaded
member.summary: This event is fired when the modal has loaded content using the remote option.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalEvent.Show
member.summary: This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called. If caused by a click, the clicked element is available as the relatedTarget property of the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.ModalEvent.Shown
member.summary: This event is fired when the modal has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete). If caused by a click, the clicked element is available as the relatedTarget property of the event.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TabOperation
member.summary: Possible operations on a tab

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TabOperation.Show
member.summary: Activates a tab element and content container. Tab should have either a data-target or an href targeting a container node in the DOM.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TabEvent
member.summary: Tab events

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TabEvent.Show
member.summary: This event fires on tab show, but before the new tab has been shown. Use event.target and event.relatedTarget to target the active tab and the previous active tab (if available) respectively.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TabEvent.Shown
member.summary: This event fires on tab show after a tab has been shown. Use event.target and event.relatedTarget to target the active tab and the previous active tab (if available) respectively.

member.name: T:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TooltipEvent
member.summary: Tooltip events

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TooltipEvent.Hide
member.summary: This event is fired immediately when the hide instance method has been called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TooltipEvent.Hidden
member.summary: This event is fired when the tooltip has finished being hidden from the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TooltipEvent.Show
member.summary: This event fires immediately when the show instance method is called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Bootstrap3.TooltipEvent.Shown
member.summary: This event is fired when the tooltip has been made visible to the user (will wait for CSS transitions to complete).
